result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Lee Douville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to 14-CF-28
2/11/2020 - Court terminates probation effective today.

miscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Time Served.  

5/28/20 - Defendant rejecting probation, re-sentenced by the Court.
To pay the costs of the action.  (costs have been paid in full)

03:57 PM Defendant Michael Lee Douville appears via Zoom video.  Colleen Nordin appeared via Zoom video for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Defendant ready to proceed without an attorney.  Defendant is rejecting probation, requests to be resentenced. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement.  Defendant in agreement with State's recommendation.  Court re-sentences defendant.

Sentencing hearing on May 28, 2020 at 03:45 pm.  THIS HEARING HAS BEEN CHANGED TO A ZOOM HEARING PURSUANT TO THE SUPREME COURT ORDER FOR REMOTE APPEARANCES.  PUBLIC ACCESS IS AVAILABLE AT WWW.WICOURTS.GOV LIVE STREAM COURTS TAB.  PLEASE FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS FOR HOW TO APPEAR REMOTELY ATTACHED.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael Lee Douville in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Defendant Michael Lee Douville in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. State gives sentencing recommendation, makes statement. Atty Maciolek gives argument on sentence, makes statement. Defendant apologizes to the court. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
for DNA Sample

Defendant Michael Lee Douville in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Defendant Michael Lee Douville in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Ct. 1.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 but reads in for sentencing purposes. Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Lee Douville in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Michael Lee Douville in custody.  Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Maciolek indicates he just received discovery material yesterday, hasn't had a chance to review it yet. Atty Maciolek requests a short adjournment. Bond remains as is.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant Michael Lee Douville in court with attorney Eric S. Maciolek.  Defendant Michael Lee Douville in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 2/19/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 6/20/14)

Preliminary hearing on March 12, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Michael Lee Douville in court with attorney Eric Maciolek.  Defendant Michael Lee Douville in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, asks that prelim. be set within the time limits. Court will set prelim within the 20 day time limit. (Set 14-CF-28 & 14-CF-30 for prelim. at same time if witnesses are available) Bond remains as is.
No contact direct or indirect with Black Stone Harbor Resort.   Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Michael Lee Douville appears by video conference along with attorney Eric Maciolek, who appears by phone.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges.  Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel.  Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 10:00 am.
